speaker: POINS
text: Come, shelter, shelter! I have removed Falstaff’s

speaker: POINS
text: horse, and he frets like a gummed velvet.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Stand close.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Poins! Poins, and be hanged! Poins!

speaker: PRINCE
text: Peace, you fat-kidneyed rascal. What a brawling

speaker: PRINCE
text: dost thou keep!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Where’s Poins, Hal?

speaker: PRINCE
text: He is walked up to the top of the hill. I’ll go

speaker: PRINCE
text: seek him.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: I am accursed to rob in that thief’s company.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: The rascal hath removed my horse and tied him I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: know not where. If I travel but four foot by the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: square further afoot, I shall break my wind. Well, I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: doubt not but to die a fair death for all this, if I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: ’scape hanging for killing that rogue. I have forsworn

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: his company hourly any time this two-and-twenty

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: years, and yet I am bewitched with the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: rogue’s company. If the rascal have not given me

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: medicines to make me love him, I’ll be hanged. It

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: could not be else: I have drunk medicines.—Poins!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Hal! A plague upon you both.—Bardolph! Peto!—

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: I’ll starve ere I’ll rob a foot further. An ’twere not as

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: good a deed as drink to turn true man and to leave

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: these rogues, I am the veriest varlet that ever

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: chewed with a tooth. Eight yards of uneven ground

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: is threescore and ten miles afoot with me, and the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: stony-hearted villains know it well enough. A plague

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: upon it when thieves cannot be true one to another!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text:
(
                They
                 
                whistle
                ,
                 
                within
                .
                )
               Whew! A plague upon you

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: all!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Give me my horse, you rogues. Give me my horse

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: and be hanged!

speaker: PRINCE
text: Peace, you fat guts! Lie down, lay thine ear

speaker: PRINCE
text: close to the ground, and list if thou canst hear the

speaker: PRINCE
text: tread of travelers.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Have you any levers to lift me up again being

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: down? ’Sblood, I’ll not bear my own flesh so

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: far afoot again for all the coin in thy father’s Exchequer.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: What a plague mean you to colt me

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: thus?

speaker: PRINCE
text: Thou liest. Thou art not colted; thou art

speaker: PRINCE
text: uncolted.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: I prithee, good Prince Hal, help me to my

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: horse, good king’s son.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Out, you rogue! Shall I be your ostler?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Hang thyself in thine own heir-apparent

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: garters! If I be ta’en, I’ll peach for this. An I have

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: not ballads made on you all and sung to filthy

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: tunes, let a cup of sack be my poison—when a jest

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: is so forward, and afoot too! I hate it.

speaker: GADSHILL
text: Stand.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: So I do, against my will.

speaker: POINS
text: O, ’tis our setter. I know his voice.

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: What news?

speaker: GADSHILL
text: Case you, case you. On with your vizards.

speaker: GADSHILL
text: There’s money of the King’s coming down the hill.

speaker: GADSHILL
text: ’Tis going to the King’s Exchequer.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: You lie, you rogue. ’Tis going to the King’s

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Tavern.

speaker: GADSHILL
text: There’s enough to make us all.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: To be hanged.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Sirs, you four shall front them in the narrow

speaker: PRINCE
text: lane. Ned Poins and I will walk lower. If they ’scape

speaker: PRINCE
text: from your encounter, then they light on us.

speaker: PETO
text: How many be there of them?

speaker: GADSHILL
text: Some eight or ten.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Zounds, will they not rob us?

speaker: PRINCE
text: What, a coward, Sir John Paunch?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Indeed, I am not John of Gaunt, your grandfather,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: but yet no coward, Hal.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Well, we leave that to the proof.

speaker: POINS
text: Sirrah Jack, thy horse stands behind the hedge.

speaker: POINS
text: When thou need’st him, there thou shalt find him.

speaker: POINS
text: Farewell and stand fast.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Now cannot I strike him, if I should be

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: hanged.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Ned, where are our disguises?

speaker: POINS
text: Here, hard by. Stand close.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Now, my masters, happy man be his dole,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: say I. Every man to his business.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              TRAVELER
text: Come, neighbor, the boy shall lead

speaker:
FIRST
               
              TRAVELER
text: our horses down the hill. We’ll walk afoot awhile

speaker:
FIRST
               
              TRAVELER
text: and ease our legs.

speaker: THIEVES
text: Stand!

speaker: TRAVELERS
text: Jesus bless us!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Strike! Down with them! Cut the villains’

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: throats! Ah, whoreson caterpillars, bacon-fed

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: knaves, they hate us youth. Down with them!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Fleece them!

speaker: TRAVELERS
text: O, we are undone, both we and ours

speaker: TRAVELERS
text: forever!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Hang, you gorbellied knaves! Are you undone?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: No, you fat chuffs. I would your store were

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: here. On, bacons, on! What, you knaves, young men

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: must live. You are grandjurors, are you? We’ll jure

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: you, faith.

speaker: PRINCE
text: The thieves have bound the true men. Now

speaker: PRINCE
text: could thou and I rob the thieves and go merrily to

speaker: PRINCE
text: London, it would be argument for a week, laughter

speaker: PRINCE
text: for a month, and a good jest forever.

speaker: POINS
text: Stand close, I hear them coming.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Come, my masters, let us share, and then to

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: horse before day. An the Prince and Poins be not

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: two arrant cowards, there’s no equity stirring.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: There’s no more valor in that Poins than in a wild

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: duck.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Your money!

speaker: POINS
text: Villains!

speaker: PRINCE
text:
Got
               
              with
               
              much
               
              ease
              .
               
              Now
               
              merrily
               
              to
               
              horse
              .

speaker: PRINCE
text:
The
               
              thieves
               
              are
               
              all
               
              scattered
              ,
               
              and
               
              possessed
               
              with
               
              fear

speaker: PRINCE
text:
So
               
              strongly
               
              that
               
              they
               
              dare
               
              not
               
              meet
               
              each
               
              other
              .

speaker: PRINCE
text:
Each
               
              takes
               
              his
               
              fellow
               
              for
               
              an
               
              officer
              .

speaker: PRINCE
text:
Away
              ,
               
              good
               
              Ned
              .
               
              Falstaff
               
              sweats
               
              to
               
              death
              ,

speaker: PRINCE
text:
And
               
              lards
               
              the
               
              lean
               
              earth
               
              as
               
              he
               
              walks
               
              along
              .

speaker: PRINCE
text:
Were
               
              ’t
               
              not
               
              for
               
              laughing
              ,
               
              I
               
              should
               
              pity
               
              him
              .

speaker: POINS
text: How the fat rogue roared!
